comment.body:
> This will likely cause breakage (idk if we removed deprecated usage or not, but certainly had some)

Ok, merging into `develop` for now. We can backport after a while.

issue.title: Better status of Multi Select Lists
issue.body:
Multi Select Lists present a status of “n values selected,” even if n is 2 and both selected values could easily be listed one by one.

See this example from frappe/frappe#37716:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6947417/278548077-d9f1fa55-d564-4d48-9847-6e219d44122b.png)

We should probably expand up to three selected items comma-separated, if they would (mostly) fit into the box. A little cut-off of the last one selected shouldn’t hurt.

If the space is too scarce, we may consider still displaying something like “B2G, D2C and two more.”

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -208,6 +221,9 @@ def get_definition(self, for_modification=False):
 		):
 			column_def += f" default {frappe.db.escape(self.default)}"
 
+		elif self.not_nullable:
+			column_def += f" not null default {frappe.db.escape('')}"
comment.body: Hmm, I guess I should split out this from the above if-elif chain and keep it standalone like `unique`.

pull_request.title: feat: allow setting fields as not nullable
pull_request.body:
Resolves #21824

This adds in a `not nullable` checkbox for docfields
If selected - this will ensure that a sane default value (0 / "") will get set instead of `NULL`

issue.title: Fix editable grid header widths.
issue.body:
Even with columns being set to a 2:2:1 relation, an almost disappearing, completely unintelligible column header should never happen:

![IMG_1949](https://github.com/frappe/frappe/assets/46800703/ae5837d8-67e4-4f24-8e8e-8c652a819708)

We can fix the above case by changing the relation to 1:1:1, but this wouldn’t be optimal either, as the checkbox column should only consume a minimum of the total available space, while the remaining columns should consume the rest.

But a minimum means: just enough for both the checkbox and its header.

comment.body:
Here, we are trying to find if that field has existing filters applied on it.
If filters are there

then we will first JSON.parse it

then change the first element in each filter to "unscrub", because that is the required format of Filter Group UI Component.

pull_request.title: feat: Apply Filters to Link Fields Via Form Builder
pull_request.body: **Explanation:** We can now add Filters to Link Fields via Form Builder. All the link fields in a Doctype will have an action icon to Select the Filters To Apply. In the above case "Company" is a "Link Field" so we get an icon in the actions(as shown above). *** After Clicking on the Icon, a dialog box will open to select the filters you want to apply. *** After clicking on apply, The results are as follows **Work Flow:** https://github.com/frappe/frappe/assets/13928957/25485360-3bff-419f-a729-d56445bd3818 **What Changed:** Added a new "DocField" called "Link Filters" `no-docs`
